intro: Dorstenia cuspidata var. cuspidata, commonly known as the "arrowhead plant," is a tropical species native to Central and South America. It is a flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its unique leaf morphology and adaptability make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
